CHAR-FEST 01.25.25

Newledo’s first annual
Biochar Celebration
Sat Jan 25th, 2PM-5PM


At CHAR-FEST
Get Biochar 101 Basics: What it is, why it's great for soil building and how to land apply it.

Learn How to make a simple kiln and use locally abundant wood chips as the material

Enjoy free BBQ and S’mores while learning about this ancient soil building solution

Contact Nicole@NewledoHub.org for more details

Based on the wisdom of pre-Columbian people who made biochar over 6000 years ago and established the fertile areas of Terra Preta in the Amazon, biochar is an exceptional, high-carbon, low ash soil amendment that works in conjunction with water and fertilizers to hold and slowly release moisture and nutrients as the plants demand.


COMPOST CAFE

Whether you’re new to composting or an expert with knowledge to share, or everyone in-between, join us for our first Compost Cafe.
Sat Feb 1st, 11AM-2PM OPEN HOUSE


Kids are welcome. We'll have kid friendly snacks and interactive composting activities to get them involved!

Coffee, canapes and conversation a plenty!

Contact Nicole@NewledoHub.org for more details

Compost - the turning of a “waste” into a beautiful material that can enrich and build healthy soil, help plants thrive and keep organic waste out of the landfill
